comments.body: This really looks clunky... is there a way we can simplify this?

I discussed this a lot with others and it seems really hard to simplify at the moment while preserving the full validation functionality.

How about we leave it as is for now, given that such specs (although shorter) have already been merged in the past (for GCF and GCE operators), and we discuss the general approach to validation at a later time on the mailing list / Slack?

If we reach a conclusion I'll be happy to revisit all the merged specs and refactor them.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@
CLOUD_SQL_VALIDATION = [
    dict(name="name", allow_empty=False),
    dict(name="settings", type="dict", fields=[
        dict(name="tier", allow_empty=False),

comments.body: Can we please add docstrings for this operator
I know it is a base operator but still if someone wants to implement something custom inherting this operator, it comes in handy to have some docstrings
